Join The Matadors









 As a destination workplace, California State University, Northridge attracts, develops, and maintains a diverse workforce of over 4,000 engaged and committed faculty and staff. CSUN is committed to achieving excellence through teaching, scholarship, learning and inclusion. Our values include a respect for all people, building partnerships with the community and the encouragement of innovation, experimentation and creativity. CSUN strives to cultivate a community in which a diverse population can learn and work in an atmosphere of civility and respect. CSUN is especially interested in candidates who make contributions to equity and inclusion in the pursuit of excellence for all members of the university community. We invite you to explore your career opportunities to work with others who are making a difference.APPLY HERE:Staff & Management ApplicantsApplications for staff and management positions are accepted online only. This also applies to our auxiliaries [The University Corporation (TUC), Associated Students (AS), and the University Student Union (USU)]. To apply click below:View Staff/Management OpportunitiesView Auxiliary Staff/Management Opportunities  Tenure-Track Faculty, Librarian, Counseling, Coaching, Lecturer, and Academic Student Employee PositionsApplications for tenure-track faculty positions are accepted online only. To view openings and apply, click on the link below:View Tenure-Track Faculty, Librarian, Counseling, and Coaching OpportunitiesView Lecturer OpportunitiesView Academic Student Employee Positions  Student Assistant Positions - The Career CenterThe Career Center at CSUN offers career exploration and advisement, along with an online job-board (Handshake), internships, and job-search strategies to students and eligible alumni. For more information, click below:  Visit the Career Center  Web Site (Fairs/Events)  The California State University SystemAs the nation's largest, most diverse university, the California State University offers challenging career opportunities in a wide range of disciplines at its 23 campuses throughout the state. For more information, click below:View Career Opportunities throughout the CSUWhen you have successfully applied for a staff or management position at CSUN, you will receive an automatically-generated email confirming our receipt of your application. If you do not receive an email from Human Resources within 24 hours of your submission, contact our office for assistance.  There is no process for walk-in or mail applications.TIPS FOR UPLOADING ATTACHMENTS: Documents with long names, certain special characters, and in formats other than PDF (.pdf) and WORD (.doc) may error out, and we will not be able to process your application. Please see tips below for uploading your attachment(s):PDF is the preferred file format.  Convert a Word (.doc) file to PDF if it contains a table, chart, special fonts/formatting, and/or graphics/images.Limit the file name of your resume and other attachments to under 25 characters in length (ex. JohndoeResume.pdf).Be sure not to include any special characters such as periods, commas, apostrophes, dashes, parenthesis, or spaces in your document title. Transcripts, Degrees or License/Certificates taken directly from the providing institution’s website may contain encrypted information; if you are going to attach these types of documents, it is best to print, re-scan and save the document as a PDF prior to uploading to our applicant system.If you have any questions, encounter problems, or need assistance, please email applications@csun.edu. SYSTEM NOTE: Due to scheduled maintenance the employment site may be down on Wednesdays from 8:00 p.m. to midnight.
